intro: Stenostephanus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its evergreen, woody structure and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are borne in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits that are typically small and round. Stenostephanus is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
